featured.text: Following him, many local people opened their own bookshops, and the small town soon became a model of sustainable rural development and tourism.
Although all book towns have a great number of bookshops, that’s where the similarities 13 .
The concept was 11 by Richard Booth, who opened the first second-hand bookshop in Hay-on-Wye, UK in 1961.

definition.zh_def: 書店，專門販售書籍的商店。
definition.en_def: A retail store that sells books.
definition.example: I bought a new novel at the local bookshop.
